get.description: - **code**: The authorize token, normally the user with a customer profile does not have access to this data. If this is the case, you can obtain new tokens in the Tokens - "Developer Portal > Profile".

400.description: Erro generating, updating or validate token, check the information.

post.description:
- **Body**: You need to enter the refresh token.
If you do not have this data, "log in" again on the portal and request
a new set of tokens (authorization_token and refresh_token).

- **Note**: When the access token expires and you request a new set of tokens,
the refresh token will also be updated! So always save the last refresh token,
so you won't have any problems. The refresh token may expire or be disabled when
you request a new set of tokens.

400.description: Erro generating, updating or validate token, check the information.

post.description:
- **Authorization**: You can check if the "authorization_token" is valid.
  Send the authorization_token in the header using the "Authorization" key.

parameters.description: The authorization token is used to validate your identity in Quartile LLC, only Quartile accounts can have API access.

schema.title: Authorization
schema.description: The authorization token is used to validate your identity in Quartile LLC, only Quartile accounts can have API access.

parameters.name: Authorization

401.description: Unauthorized. Access token is missing or invalid.

parameters.description: Token from a previous request. Use in conjunction with the **maxResults** parameter to control pagination of the returned array.

schema.title: Nexttoken
schema.description: Token from a previous request. Use in conjunction with the **maxResults** parameter to control pagination of the returned array.

parameters.name: nextToken

parameters.description: Sets the maximum number of records returned per request. Use in conjunction with the **nextToken** parameter to control pagination. For example, supplying maxResults=20 with a previously returned token will fetch up to the next 20 items. In some cases, fewer items may be returned. Defaults to max page size (1000 per page).

schema.title: Maxresults
schema.description: Sets the maximum number of records returned per request. Use in conjunction with the **nextToken** parameter to control pagination. For example, supplying maxResults=20 with a previously returned token will fetch up to the next 20 items. In some cases, fewer items may be returned. Defaults to max page size (1000 per page).

parameters.name: maxResults

get.description:
After requesting the reportId in the **POST** method. Request the report URL to download the file.
- **status_code 200**: use reportURL to download the report.
- **status_code 204**: reportURL invalid.
- **status_code 206**: continue, the report is being generated, keep requesting.
- **status_code 422**: there may have been an error in generating the report, request again using **POST** method.

post.description:
Request the creation of a performance report for all entities of a single type which have performance data to report.
- **Report Type**: Record types can be one of campaign, keyword, product or target.
- **Format Type**: You can request that the report be generated as JSON or CSV.
- **Dates**: The period between startDate and endDate dates must be between 1 and 30 days.

About the response.
- **Report Id**: You will use to request the URL of the file to download, use the GET method.
- **Time**: Reports can take between 2 and 20 minutes, depends on the type of report and our demand.

post.description:
The endpoint You will be able to change ACOS on the ASIN level.
The need to have a higher ACOS tolerance and bid higher on specific search terms or By setting an ACoS% at a product level, the system will understand that this Product/ASIN will not be required to achieve the Account's Campaign/Overall ACoS%, meaning that the Quartile system will look at this product/ASIN individually and try to take it to its ACoS% target.

The endpoint You will be able to change ACOS on the Campaign level.
By setting an ACoS% at a campaign level, the system will understand that this campaign will not be required to achieve the Account's Campaign/Overall ACoS%, meaning that the Quartile system will look at this campaign individually and try to take it to its ACoS% target.

Endpoint able to separate all ASINs into different groups, inputting further information relevant to your report.
Having more information to compare, analyze and take important decisions for your business will help you compare multiple products and understand what is bringing you results and what is not.

endDate.title: Enddate
